comments:
This appears to cause no problems in Eclispe, but, apparently, from another OSGI tool I run, the datatools manifest.mf file are not quite right. (I'll paste all error messages below). Did eclipse (PDE) create the manifest.mf files for you this way? (If so, perhaps its a bug on them) Or are you "hand editing" them somehow? 
Also seems the error message is slightly inaccurate. I think you just need to move the 'Bundle-ManifestVersion: 2' to be the _second_ line of the manifest.mf file. that seems to the be way the others are.

Hmm, now I'm not so sure ... I've seen other plugins now that did not always start with 
Manifest-Version: 1.0
Bundle-ManifestVersion: 2


so ... maybe something I don't understand completely. 

So, may be this goes in the maybe investigate someday category?

Hey John,

I don't know where these plugins come from.  They are not in CVS.  Are they part of the distrobution?

Rob
These are auto-generated from templates as part of the feature definitions for DTP. The ordering of properties in the manifest files has been fixed in RC5.

My mistake, the little tool I was using that "found" these errors was looking at old and new stuff ... I have confirmed the new stuff is correct and the old stuff is no longer seen by anyone else. 

But ... I must respond to one of the comments in this bug ... these really SHOULD be in cvs repository! You might be able to get by with "template" versions for simple stuff, but eventually I would think you'd have some stuff in there that you'd want people to get when they loaded the code from cvs! (for example, if something was marked x-internal, or x-friend, they might need to "see" the version ranges of pre-reqs, etc.  In general, I think Eclipse developers are used to the model of being able to load things from CVS, and have it "get everything they'd need" to match what ever was in the build. 

Of course, I may not know what I'm talking about for your situation, or this point in time, so ... just take this as friendly advice.
Thanks, David. We'll make sure these templates are in CVS, if they are not already.
